{{pp-pc1|expiry=21:19, 20 May 2019|small=yes}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2013}} [[File:HIV-1 Transmission electron micrograph AIDS02bbb lores.jpg|thumb|right|250px|[[Transmission electron microscopy|Electron micrograph]] of the [[human immunodeficiency virus]]. HIV/AIDS denialists dispute the existence of HIV or its role in causing AIDS.]] '''HIV/AIDS denialism''' is the belief, contradicted by conclusive medical and scientific evidence,<ref name=iomreport/><ref name=niaid/> that [[human immunodeficiency virus]] (HIV) does not cause [[acquired immune deficiency syndrome]] (AIDS).{{sfn|Kalichman|2009|p= [https://books.google.com/books?id=_mtDBCDwxugC&pg=PA205 205]}} Some of its proponents reject the existence of HIV, while others accept that HIV exists but argue that it is a harmless [[passenger virus]] and not the cause of AIDS. Insofar as they acknowledge AIDS as a real disease, they attribute it to some combination of [[Human sexual activity|sexual behavior]], [[recreational drug]]s, [[malnutrition]], poor [[sanitation]], [[haemophilia]], or the effects of [[antiretroviral drug|the drugs used to treat HIV infection]].<ref name = CohenScience1994>{{Cite journal | last1 = Cohen | first1 = J | title = Duesberg and critics agree: Hemophilia is the best test | journal = Science | volume = 266 | issue = 5191 | pages = 1645–6 | year = 1994 | pmid = 7992044| doi=10.1126/science.7992044|bibcode = 1994Sci...266.1645C }}</ref>{{sfn|Kalichman|2009}}
The [[scientific consensus]] is that the evidence showing HIV to be the cause of AIDS is conclusive<ref name=iomreport/><ref name=niaid/> and that HIV/AIDS denialist claims are [[pseudoscience]] based on [[conspiracy theory|conspiracy theories]],<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Kalichman|first1= SC|title=The Psychology of AIDS Denialism|journal=European Psychologist|date=1 January 2014|volume=19|issue=1|pages=13–22|doi=10.1027/1016-9040/a000175}}</ref> faulty reasoning, [[Cherry picking (fallacy)|cherry picking]], and misrepresentation of mainly outdated scientific data.<ref name=iomreport/><ref name=niaid/><ref name="denying science">{{cite journal |title=Denying science |journal=Nat. Med. |volume=12 |issue=4 |page=369 |year=2006 |pmid=16598265 |doi=10.1038/nm0406-369|quote=To support their ideas, some AIDS denialists have also misappropriated a scientific review in ''Nature Medicine'' which opens with this reasonable statement: "Despite considerable advances in HIV science in the past 20 years, the reason why HIV-1 infection is pathogenic is still debated." }}</ref> With the rejection of these arguments by the scientific community, HIV/AIDS denialist material is now targeted at less scientifically sophisticated audiences and spread mainly through the Internet.<ref name=SmithNovella/><ref name="NewScientist">{{cite journal | url = https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg20227131.500-aids-denial-a-lethal-delusion.html | title = AIDS denial: A lethal delusion | first = J | last = Steinberg | journal = New Scientist | accessdate =14 October 2009 | date = 17 June 2009 | volume = 2713 }}</ref>
Despite its lack of scientific acceptance, HIV/AIDS denialism has had a significant political impact, especially [[HIV/AIDS denialism in South Africa|in South Africa]] under the presidency of [[Thabo Mbeki]]. Scientists and physicians have raised alarm at the human cost of HIV/AIDS denialism, which discourages HIV-positive people from using proven treatments.<ref name=niaid>{{cite web | url = https://aidsinfo.nih.gov/news/528/the-evidence-that-hiv-causes-aids | title = The Evidence that HIV Causes AIDS | accessdate =14 October 2009 | publisher = [[National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease]] | date = 4 September 2009 }}</ref><ref name=SmithNovella/><ref name=Cohen>{{cite journal |last=Cohen |first= J |title=The Duesberg phenomenon |journal=Science |volume=266 |issue=5191 |pages=1642–4 |date=December 1994 |pmid=7992043 |format=PDF |doi=10.1126/science.7992043 |url=http://www.sciencemag.org/feature/data/cohen/266-5191-1642a.pdf |accessdate=22 June 2009 |bibcode=1994Sci...266.1642C}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last = Watson |first= J | title = Scientists, activists sue South Africa's AIDS 'denialists' | journal = Nat. Med. | volume = 12| issue = 1 | page = 6| year = 2006 | pmid = 16397537 | doi = 10.1038/nm0106-6a }}</ref><ref>{{cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/international/story/0,,1483792,00.html | title = Discredited doctor's 'cure' for Aids ignites life-and-death struggle in South Africa | first = S | last = Boseley |work=The Guardian | date = 14 May 2005 | accessdate =14 October 2009 | location=London}}</ref><ref name=durbandec>{{cite journal |author= ,|title=The Durban Declaration |journal=Nature |volume=406 |issue=6791 |pages=15–6 |year=2000 |pmid=10894520 |doi=10.1038/35017662 |url=http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v406/n6791/full/406015a0.html}}</ref> Public health researchers have attributed 330,000 to 340,000 AIDS-related deaths, along with 171,000 other HIV infections and 35,000 infant HIV infections, to the South African government's former embrace of HIV/AIDS denialism.<ref name=chigwedere>{{cite journal |last1= Chigwedere |first1= P |last2= Seage |first2= GR |last3= Gruskin |first3= S |last4= Lee |first4= TH |last5= Essex |first5= M |display-authors= 2 |title=Estimating the lost benefits of antiretroviral drug use in South Africa |journal=Journal of Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndromes |volume= 49|issue= 4|pages= 410–15|date=October 2008 |pmid=19186354 |doi=10.1097/QAI.0b013e31818a6cd5 |laysummary=http://www.hsph.harvard.edu/news/press-releases/2008-releases/researchers-estimate-lives-lost-delay-arv-drug-use-hivaids-south-africa.html}}</ref><ref name=NattrassAA>{{cite journal |last= Nattrass |first= N |title= AIDS and the scientific governance of medicine in post-Apartheid South Africa |journal=African Affairs |volume=107 |issue=427 |pages=157–76 |date=February 2008 |doi=10.1093/afraf/adm087 }}</ref> The interrupted use of antiretroviral treatments is also a major global concern as it potentially increases the likelihood of the emergence of antiretroviral-resistant strains of the virus.<ref>{{cite journal | pmid=22686620 | title=HIV-1 antiretroviral resistance: scientific principles and clinical applications | journal=Drugs | year=2012 | doi=10.2165/11633630-000000000-00000 | volume=72 | issue=9 | pmc=3689909 | pages=e1–25 |last1=Tang |first1= MW |last2= Shafer |first2= RW }}</ref> {{TOC limit|3}}
==History== A constellation of symptoms named "[[Gay-related immune deficiency]]" was noted in 1982. In 1983, a group of scientists and doctors at the [[Pasteur Institute]] in France, led by [[Luc Montagnier]], discovered a new virus in a patient with signs and symptoms that often preceded AIDS.<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Barré-Sinoussi |first1= F |last2= Chermann |first2= J |last3= Rey |first3= F |last4= Nugeyre |first4= M |last5= Chamaret |first5= S |last6= Gruest |first6= J |last7= Dauguet |first7= C |last8= Axler-Blin |first8= C |last9= Vézinet-Brun |first9= F |last10= Rouzioux |first10= C |last11= Rozenbaum |first11= W |last12= Montagnier |display-authors= 2 |first12= L |title= Isolation of a T-lymphotropic retrovirus from a patient at risk for acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS) |journal= Science |volume= 220 |issue= 4599 |pages= 868–71 |year= 1983 |pmid= 6189183 |doi= 10.1126/science.6189183 |bibcode= 1983Sci...220..868B}}</ref> They named the virus ''lymphadenopathy-associated virus'', or LAV, and sent samples to [[Robert Gallo]]'s team in the United States. Their findings were [[peer reviewed]] and slated for publication in ''[[Science (journal)|Science]]''.
At a 23 April 1984 press conference in Washington, D.C., [[Margaret Heckler]], Secretary of [[Health and Human Services]], announced that Gallo and his co-workers had discovered a virus that is the "probable" cause of AIDS. This virus was initially named HTLV-III.<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Sarngadharan |first1=MG |last2= DeVico |first2= AL |last3= Bruch |first3= L |last4= Schüpbach |first4= J |last5= Gallo |first5= RC |display-authors= 2 |title= HTLV-III: The etiologic agent of AIDS |journal= Int. Symp. Princess Takamatsu Cancer Res. Fund |volume= 15 |pages= 301–8 |year= 1984 |pmid= 6100648 |url=}}</ref> That same year, Casper Schmidt responded to Gallo's papers with "The Group-Fantasy Origins of AIDS", ''[[Journal of Psychohistory]]''.<ref>{{cite journal |last= Schmidt |first= C |title= The group-fantasy origins of AIDS |journal = [[Journal of Psychohistory]] |volume= 12 |issue= 1 |pages= 37–78 |year= 1984 |pmid= 11611586}}</ref> Schmidt posited that AIDS was not an actual disease, but rather an example of "[[epidemic hysteria]]" in which groups of people are subconsciously acting out social conflicts. Schmidt compared AIDS to documented cases of epidemic hysteria in the past which were mistakenly thought to be infectious. (Schmidt himself would later die of AIDS in 1994.){{sfn|Kalichman|2009|p= [https://books.google.com/books?id=_mtDBCDwxugC&pg=PA26 26]}}<ref name="denialists-who-have-died">{{cite web |work= aidstruth.org |url= http://www.aidstruth.org/denialism/dead_denialists |title= AIDS Denialists Who Have Died |accessdate= 15 June 2009 |archive-date= 26 January 2010 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20100126000256/http://www.aidstruth.org/denialism/dead_denialists |deadurl= yes}}</ref>
In 1986, the viruses discovered by Montagnier and Gallo, found to be genetically indistinguishable, were renamed HIV.<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Coffin |first1= J |last2= Haase |first2= A |last3= Levy |first3= J |last4= Montagnier |first4= L |last5= Oroszlan |first5= S |last6= Teich |first6= N |last7= Temin |first7= H |last8= Toyoshima |first8= K |last9= Varmus |first9= H |last10= Vogt |first10= P |display-authors= 2 |title= What to call the AIDS virus? |journal= Nature |volume= 321 |issue= 6065 |page= 10 |year= 1986 |pmid= 3010128 |doi= 10.1038/321010a0 |bibcode = 1986Natur.321...10.}}</ref>
In 1987, the molecular biologist [[Peter Duesberg]] questioned the link between HIV and AIDS in the journal ''[[Cancer Research (journal)|Cancer Research]]''.<ref name=duesberg1987>{{cite journal |last= Duesberg |first= P |title= Retroviruses as carcinogens and pathogens: Expectations and reality |journal= [[Cancer Research (journal)|Cancer Research]] |volume= 47 |issue= 5 |pages= 1199–220 |year= 1987 |pmid= 3028606}}</ref> Duesberg's publication coincided with the start of major [[public health]] campaigns and the development of [[zidovudine]] (AZT) as a treatment for HIV/AIDS.
In 1988, a panel of the [[Institute of Medicine]] of the [[U.S. National Academy of Sciences]] found that "the evidence that HIV causes AIDS is scientifically conclusive."<ref name=iomreport>{{cite web | url = http://books.nap.edu/openbook.php?record_id=771&page=2 | title = Confronting AIDS: Update 1988 | publisher = [[Institute of Medicine]] of the [[U.S. National Academy of Sciences]] | year = 1988 | quote = …the evidence that HIV causes AIDS is scientifically conclusive.}}</ref> That same year, ''Science'' published Blattner, Gallo, and Temin's "HIV causes AIDS",<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Blattner |first1= W |last2= Gallo |first2= RC |last3= Temin |first3= HM |title= HIV causes AIDS |journal= Science |volume= 241 |issue= 4865 |pages= 515–6 |year= 1988 |pmid= 3399881 |doi= 10.1126/science.3399881 |url= http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/reprint/241/4865/515 |bibcode= 1988Sci...241..515B}}</ref> and Duesberg's "HIV is not the cause of AIDS".<ref>{{cite journal |last= Duesberg |first= P |title= HIV is not the cause of AIDS |journal= Science |volume= 241 |issue= 4865 |page= 514 |year= 1988 |pmid= 3399880 |doi= 10.1126/science.3399880 |url= http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/reprint/241/4865/514|bibcode = 1988Sci...241..514D}}</ref> Also that same year, the [[The Perth Group|Perth Group]], a group of denialists based in [[Perth, Western Australia]] led by Eleni Papadopulos-Eleopulos, published in the non-peer-reviewed journal ''[[Medical Hypotheses]]'' their first article questioning aspects of HIV/AIDS research,<ref>{{cite journal |last= Papadopulos-Eleopulos |first= E |title= Reappraisal of AIDS – Is the oxidation induced by the risk factors the primary cause? |journal= [[Medical Hypotheses]] |volume= 25 |issue= 3 |pages= 151–62 |year=1988 |pmid= 3285143 |doi= 10.1016/0306-9877(88)90053-9 |url= http://theperthgroup.com/SCIPAPERS/reappraisalofaids.html}}</ref> arguing that there was "no compelling reason for preferring the viral hypothesis of AIDS to one based on the activity of oxidising agents."
In 1989, Duesberg exercised his right, as a member of the National Academy of Sciences, to bypass the peer review process and publish his arguments in ''[[Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America]]'' (''PNAS'') unreviewed. The editor of ''PNAS'' initially resisted, but ultimately allowed Duesberg to publish, saying, "If you wish to make these unsupported, vague, and prejudicial statements in print, so be it. But I cannot see how this would be convincing to any scientifically trained reader."<ref name=sciencebooth/>
In 1990, [[Robert Root-Bernstein]] published his first peer-reviewed article detailing his objections to the mainstream view of AIDS and HIV.<ref>{{cite journal |last= Root-Bernstein |first= R |title= Do we know the cause(s) of AIDS? |journal= [[Perspectives in Biology and Medicine]] |volume= 33 |issue= 4 |pages= 480–500 |year= 1990 |pmid= 2216658}}</ref> In it, he questioned both the mainstream view and the "dissident" view as potentially inaccurate.
In 1991, The Group for the Scientific Reappraisal of the HIV-AIDS Hypothesis, comprising twelve scientists, doctors, and activists, submitted a short letter to various journals, but the letter was rejected.<ref>{{cite book | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=kZOso0FMsrMC | title=Impure Science: AIDS, Activism, and the Politics of Knowledge | publisher=University of California Press |last= Epstein |first= Steven | year=1996 | pages=143–4 |isbn= 9780520921252}}</ref>
In 1993, ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'' published an editorial arguing that Duesberg had forfeited his [[right of reply]] by engaging in disingenuous rhetorical techniques and ignoring any evidence that conflicted with his claims.<ref>{{cite journal |last= Maddox |first= J |title= Has Duesberg a right of reply? |journal= Nature |volume= 363 |issue= 6425 |page= 109 |year= 1993 |pmid= 8483492 |doi= 10.1038/363109a0 |bibcode= 1993Natur.363..109M}}</ref> That same year, Papadopulos-Eleopulos et al. of the Perth Group, alleged in the journal ''[[Nature Biotechnology]]'' (then edited by fellow denialist [[Harvey Bialy]]) that the [[Western blot]] test for HIV was not standardized, non-reproducible, and of unknown specificity due to a claimed lack of a "[[Gold standard (test)|gold standard]]".<ref name= "Papadopulos1993">{{cite journal |last1= Papadopulos-Eleopulos |first1= E |last2= Turner |first2= VF |last3= Papadimitriou |first3= JM |title= Is a positive western blot proof of HIV infection? |journal= [[Nature Biotechnology]] |volume= 11 |issue= 6 |pages= 696–707 |year= 1993 |pmid= 7763673 |doi= 10.1038/nbt0693-696 |url= http://theperthgroup.com/SCIPAPERS/biotek8.html}}</ref>{{sfn|Kalichman|2009|p= [https://books.google.com/books?id=_mtDBCDwxugC&pg=PA170 170]}}
On 28 October 1994, [[Robert Willner]], a physician whose medical license had been revoked for, among other things, treating an AIDS patient with [[ozone therapy]], publicly jabbed his finger with blood he said was from an HIV-infected patient.<ref name=Cohen/> Willner died in 1995 of a heart attack.<ref>{{cite web |last= Bugl |first= P |title= The Rise of HIV/AIDS |publisher= Department of Mathematics, University of Hartford |url= http://uhavax.hartford.edu/bugl/rise.htm |accessdate= 22 January 2007 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20070204142451/http://uhavax.hartford.edu/bugl/rise.htm |archivedate= 4 February 2007 <!--DASHBot--> |deadurl= no}}</ref>
In 1995, The Group for the Scientific Reappraisal of the HIV-AIDS Hypothesis in 1991 published a letter in ''Science'' similar to the one they had attempted to publish in 1991.<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Baumann |first1= E |last2= Bethell |first2= T |last3= Bialy |first3= H |last4= Duesberg |first4= P |last5= Farber |first5= C |last6= Geshekter |first6= C |last7= Johnson |first7= P |last8= Maver |first8= R |last9= Schoch |first9= R |last10= Stewart |first10= G |display-authors= 2 |title= AIDS proposal. Group for the Scientific Reappraisal of the HIV/AIDS Hypothesis |journal= Science |volume= 267 |issue= 5200 |pages= 945–6 |year= 1995 |pmid= 7863335 |doi= 10.1126/science.267.5200.945 |bibcode= 1995Sci...267..945B|doi-broken-date= 2018-05-26 }}</ref> That same year, Continuum, a denialist group, placed an advertisement in the British gay and lesbian magazine ''[[Pink Paper|The Pink Paper]]'' offering a £1,000 reward to "the first person finding one scientific paper establishing actual isolation of HIV", according to a set of seven steps they claimed to have been drawn up by the Pasteur Institute in 1973.<ref name=isolatedFacts>{{cite journal |url= http://www.aegis.com/pubs/atu/1996/ATU4004.html |title= Isolated facts about HIV: A response to claims by AIDS dissidents that HIV doesn't exist |last= King |first= E |journal= AIDS Treatment Update |issue= 40 |year= 1996 |deadurl= yes |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20100420063137/http://www.aegis.com/pubs/atu/1996/ATU4004.html |archive-date= 20 April 2010 |df= dmy-all }}</ref> The challenge was later dismissed by various scientists, including Duesberg, asserting that HIV undoubtedly exists.<ref name = isolatedFacts/> Stefan Lanka argued in the same year that HIV does not exist.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.virusmyth.com/aids/hiv/slartefact.htm |title= HIV; reality or artefact? |first= Stefan |last= Lanka |date= April–May 1995 |work= Continuum |via= virusmyth.com}}</ref> Also that year, the [[National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases]] released a report concluding that "abundant epidemiologic, virologic and immunologic data support the conclusion that infection with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is the underlying cause of AIDS."<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://aidsinfo.nih.gov/news/218/the-relationship-between-the-human-immunodeficiency-virus-and-the-acquired-immunodeficiency-syndrome-(part-i) |title=The Relationship between the Human Immunodeficiency Virus and the Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (Part I)|website=National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases |publication-date=24 July 1995 |deadurl= yes |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20170414080947/https://aidsinfo.nih.gov/news/218/the-relationship-between-the-human-immunodeficiency-virus-and-the-acquired-immunodeficiency-syndrome-(part-i) |archive-date= 14 April 2017 |publisher= National Institutes of Health}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://aidsinfo.nih.gov/news/219/the-relationship-between-the-human-immunodeficiency-virus-and-the-acquired-immunodeficiency-syndrome--part-ii- |title=The Relationship between the Human Immunodeficiency Virus and the Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (Part II)|website=National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases |publication-date=24 July 1995 |deadurl= yes |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20170414082040/https://aidsinfo.nih.gov/news/219/the-relationship-between-the-human-immunodeficiency-virus-and-the-acquired-immunodeficiency-syndrome--part-ii- |archive-date= 14 April 2017 |publisher= National Institutes of Health}}</ref>
In 1996, the ''[[British Medical Journal]]'' published "Response: arguments contradict the "foreign protein-zidovudine" hypothesis"<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Sabin |first1= CA |last2= Phillips |first2= AN |last3= Lee |first3= CA |title= Response: Arguments contradict the "foreign protein-zidovudine" hypothesis |journal= BMJ |volume= 312 |issue= 7025 |pages= 211–2 |year= 1996 |pmid= 8563584 |pmc= 2350000 |url= http://www.bmj.com/cgi/content/full/312/7025/211 |doi=10.1136/bmj.312.7025.211}}</ref> as a response to a petition by Duesberg: "In 1991 Duesberg challenged researchers… We and Darby et al. have provided that evidence". The paper argued that Duesberg was wrong regarding the cause of AIDS in haemophiliacs. In 1997, The Perth Group questioned the existence of HIV, and speculated that the production of antibodies recognizing HIV proteins can be caused by allogenic stimuli and [[autoimmune disorders]].<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Papadopulos-Eleopulos |first1= E |last2= Turner |first2= VF |last3= Papadimitriou |first3= JM |last4= Stewart |first4= G |last5= Causer |first5= D |display-authors= 2 |title= HIV antibodies: Further questions and a plea for clarification |journal= [[Current Medical Research and Opinion]] |volume= 13 |issue= 10 |pages= 627–34 |year= 1997 |pmid= 9327197 |doi= 10.1185/03007999709113336 |url= http://theperthgroup.com/SCIPAPERS/epcurmedres97.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last1= Papadopulos-Eleopulos |first1= E |last2= Turner |first2= VF |last3= Papadimitriou |first3= JM |last4= Causer |first4= D |last5= Page |first5= BA |display-authors= 2 |title= HIV antibody tests and viral load — More unanswered questions and a further plea for clarification |journal= Current Medical Research and Opinion |volume= 14 |issue= 3 |pages= 185–6 |year= 1998 |pmid= 9787984 |doi= 10.1185/03007999809113358 |url= http://theperthgroup.com/SCIPAPERS/furtherplea.html}}</ref> They continued to repeat this speculation through at least 2006.<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Papadopulos-Eleopulos |first1= E |last2= Turner |first2= VF |last3= Page |first3= BA |last4= Papadimitriou |first4= J |last5= Causer |first5= D |display-authors= 2 |title= No proof HIV antibodies are caused by a retroviral infection |journal= [[Emergency Medicine Australasia]] |department= Letters to the Editor |volume= 18 |issue= 3 |pages= 308–10 |year= 2006 |pmid= 16712545 |doi= 10.1111/j.1742-6723.2006.00859.x |url= http://theperthgroup.com/SCIPAPERS/EMAHIVLetterandReply.pdf}}</ref>
In 1998, [[Joan Shenton]] published the book ''Positively False – Exposing the Myths Around HIV and AIDS'', which promotes AIDS denialism. In the book, Shenton claims that AIDS is a conspiracy created by pharmaceutical companies to make money from selling antiretroviral drugs.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.vice.com/en_uk/read/aids-denialism-is-a-killer-syndrome | title=Let's Be Clear About This: HIV Denial Kills | work=[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]] | date=18 February 2015 | accessdate=10 October 2016 | author=Morgan, Eleanor}}</ref>
In 2006, [[Celia Farber]], a journalist and prominent HIV/AIDS denialist, published an essay in the March issue of ''[[Harper's Magazine]]'' entitled "Out of Control: AIDS and the Corruption of Medical Science", in which she summarized a number of arguments for HIV/AIDS denialism and alleged incompetence, [[Conspiracy (crime)|conspiracy]], and fraud on the part of the medical community.<ref name=harpers>{{cite news |first= C |last= Farber |title= Out of control: AIDS and the corruption of medical science |magazine =[[Harper's Magazine]] |date=March 2006 |url= http://www.harpers.org/archive/2006/03/0080961 |accessdate= 11 June 2009 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090504174126/http://www.harpers.org/archive/2006/03/0080961 |archivedate= 4 May 2009 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> Scientists and AIDS activists extensively criticized the article as inaccurate, misleading, and poorly fact-checked.<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2006/03/13/business/media/13harpers.html |title= An article in Harper's ignites a controversy over HIV |last= Miller |first= L |newspaper= The New York Times |date= 13 March 2006 |accessdate= 25 May 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.tac.org.za/Documents/ErrorsInFarberArticle.pdf |last1= Gallo |first1= R |last2= Geffen |first2= N |last3= Gonsalves |first3= G |last4= Jefferys |first4= R |last5= Kuritzkes |first5= DR |last6= Mirken |first6= B |last7= Moore |first7= JP |last8= Safrit |first8= JT |display-authors= 2 |title= Errors in Celia Farber's March 2006 article in Harper's Magazine |publisher= [[Treatment Action Campaign]] |date= 25 March 2006 |accessdate= 11 June 2009 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090616194132/http://tac.org.za/Documents/ErrorsInFarberArticle.pdf |archivedate= 16 June 2009 |deadurl= yes |df= dmy-all }}</ref>
In 2007, members of the Perth Group testified at an appeals hearing for [[Andre Chad Parenzee]], asserting that HIV could not be transmitted by heterosexual sex. The judge concluded, "I reject the evidence of Ms Papadopulos-Eleopulos and Dr Turner. I conclude… that they are not qualified to give expert opinions."<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/news/national/shadow-of-doubters/2007/05/04/1177788403414.html?page=fullpage |newspaper= [[Brisbane Times]] |title= Shadow of doubters |date= 5 May 2007 |accessdate= 11 June 2009 |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090427144255/http://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/news/national/shadow-of-doubters/2007/05/04/1177788403414.html?page=fullpage |archivedate= 27 April 2009 <!--DASHBot--> |deadurl= no}}</ref>
In 2009, a paper was published in the then non-peer-reviewed journal ''[[Medical Hypotheses]]'' by Duesberg and four other researchers which criticized a 2008 study by Chigwedere et al. which found that HIV/AIDS denialism in South Africa resulted in hundreds of thousands of preventable deaths from HIV/AIDS, because the government delayed the provision of antiretroviral drugs. The paper concluded that "the claims that HIV has caused huge losses of African lives are unconfirmed and that HIV is not sufficient or even necessary to cause the previously known diseases, now called AIDS in the presence of antibody against HIV."<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Duesberg|first1=PH|last2=Nicholson|first2=JM|last3=Rasnick|first3=D|last4=Fiala|first4=C|last5=Bauer|first5=HH |display-authors= 2 |title=WITHDRAWN: HIV-AIDS hypothesis out of touch with South African AIDS - A new perspective.|journal=[[Medical Hypotheses]]|date=19 July 2009|pmid=19619953|url=http://www.duesberg.com/2009_Duesberg_et_al_Medical_Hypotheses.pdf|doi=10.1016/j.mehy.2009.06.024}}</ref> Later that year, the paper was withdrawn from the journal on the grounds of it having methodological flaws, and that it contained assertions "that could potentially be damaging to global public health”.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.nature.com/news/paper-denying-hiv-aids-link-secures-publication-1.9737 | title=Paper denying HIV–AIDS link secures publication | work=[[Nature (journal)|Nature]] | date=5 January 2012 | accessdate=10 October 2016 |last= Corbyn |first= Zöe}}</ref>
===U.S. courts=== In 1998, HIV/AIDS denialism and parental rights clashed with the medical establishment in court when Maine resident Valerie Emerson fought for the right to refuse to give AZT to her four-year-old son, Nikolas Emerson, after she witnessed the death of her daughter Tia, who died at the age of three in 1996. Her right to stop treatment was upheld by the court in light of "her unique experience."<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.nytimes.com/1998/09/20/us/boy-is-healthy-without-drug-for-hiv-mother-says.html |title= Boy is healthy without drug for HIV, mother says |newspaper= [[The New York Times]] |date= 20 September 1998 |accessdate= 11 June 2009}}</ref> Nikolas Emerson died eight years later. The family refused to reveal whether the death was AIDS related.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.boston.com/news/globe/obituaries/articles/2006/03/10/nikolas_emerson_11_case_led_to_legal_fight_over_hiv/ |title= Nikolas Emerson, 11; Case led to legal fight over HIV |accessdate= 11 June 2009 |date= 10 March 2006 |last= Harkavy |first= J |newspaper= Boston Globe}}</ref>
===South Africa=== In 2000, South Africa's President [[Thabo Mbeki]] invited several HIV/AIDS denialists to join his Presidential AIDS Advisory Panel.<ref name="vv">{{Cite news |url=http://www.villagevoice.com/news/0027,schoofs2,16283,1.html |title=Debating the obvious: Inside the South African government's controversial AIDS panel |last=Schoofs |first=M |date=5 July 2000 |work=[[Village Voice]] |access-date=11 June 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080617232941/https://www.villagevoice.com/news/0027,schoofs2,16283,1.html |archive-date=17 June 2008}}</ref> A response named the [[Durban Declaration]] was issued affirming the [[scientific consensus]] that HIV causes AIDS:
: "The declaration has been signed by over 5,000 people, including Nobel Prize winners, directors of leading research institutions, scientific academies and medical societies, notably the US National Academy of Sciences, the US Institute of Medicine, Max Planck institutes, the European Molecular Biology Organization, the Pasteur Institute in Paris, the Royal Society of London, the AIDS Society of India and the National Institute of Virology in South Africa. In addition, thousands of individual scientists and doctors have signed, including many from the countries bearing the greatest burden of the epidemic. Signatories are of MD, PhD level or equivalent, although scientists working for commercial companies were asked not to sign."<ref name=durbandec/>
In 2008, [[University of Cape Town]] researcher [[Nicoli Nattrass]], and later that year a group of Harvard scientists led by Zimbabwean physician [[Pride Chigwedere]] each independently estimated that Thabo Mbeki's denialist policies led to the early deaths of more than 330,000 South Africans.<ref name=chigwedere/><ref name=NattrassAA/> [[Barbara Hogan]], the health minister appointed by Mbeki's successor, voiced shame over the studies' findings and stated: "The era of denialism is over completely in South Africa."<ref name="nyt-dugger"/>
In 2009, Fraser McNeill wrote an article arguing that South Africa's reluctance to openly address HIV/AIDS resulted from social conventions that prevent people from talking about causes of death in certain situations, rather than from Mbeki's denialist views.<ref>{{Cite journal |last=McNeill |first= FG |date= 1 July 2009 |title=‘Condoms Cause Aids’: Poison, Prevention and Denial in Venda, South Africa |url=https://academic.oup.com/afraf/article/108/432/353/113835/Condoms-Cause-Aids-Poison-Prevention-and-Denial-in |journal=African Affairs |volume=108 |issue=432 |pages=353–70 |doi=10.1093/afraf/adp020 |issn=0001-9909}}</ref> Similarly, political scientist Anthony Butler has argued that "South African HIV/AIDS policy can be explained without appeals to leadership irrationality or wider cultural denialism."<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Butler |first=A |date= 1 October 2005 |title=South Africa’s HIV/AIDS policy, 1994–2004: How can it be explained? |url=https://academic.oup.com/afraf/article/104/417/591/32035/South-Africa-s-HIV-AIDS-policy-1994-2004-How-can |journal=African Affairs |volume=104 |issue=417 |pages=591–614 |doi=10.1093/afraf/adi036 |issn=0001-9909}}</ref>
In July 2016 [[Aaron Motsoaledi]], the Health Minister of South Africa, wrote an article for the Centre for Health Journalism in which he criticised past South African leaders for their denialism, describing it as an "unlucky moment" in a country which has since become a leader in treatment and prevention.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://bhekisisa.org/article/2016-07-15-aids2016-health-minister-aaron-motsoaledi-admits-that-key-leaders-were-in-denial |title= #AIDS2016: Health Minister Aaron Motsoaledi admits that 'key leaders were in denial' |last= Motsoaledi |first= Aaron |date= 20 July 2016 |publisher= Bhekisisa: Center for Health Journalism}}</ref>
==Denialists' claims and scientific evidence== {{See also|Duesberg hypothesis}}
Although members of the HIV/AIDS denialist community are united by their disagreement with the scientific finding that HIV is the cause of AIDS, the specific positions taken by various groups differ. Denialists claim many incompatible things: HIV does not exist; HIV has not been adequately isolated,<ref>{{cite web |last= Turner |first= V |year= 1999 |url= http://www.virusmyth.com/aids/hiv/vtcorweiss.htm |title= E-Mail Correspondence Between Val Turner and Robin Weiss |work= virusmyth.com}}</ref> HIV does not fulfill [[Koch's postulates]],<ref name=duesbergpnas>{{cite journal |last= Duesberg |first= P |title= Human immunodeficiency virus and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome: Correlation but not causation |journal= [[Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America]] |volume= 86 |issue= 3 |pages= 755–64 |year= 1989 |pmid= 2644642 |doi= 10.1073/pnas.86.3.755 |pmc= 286556 |bibcode= 1989PNAS...86..755D}}</ref> [[HIV test]]ing is inaccurate,<ref name= "Papadopulos1993"/> and that [[antibody|antibodies]] to HIV neutralize the virus and render it harmless.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.healtoronto.com/10reasons.html |work= HealToronto.com |title= 10 Scientific Reasons Why HIV Cannot Cause AIDS |accessdate= 28 September 2006 |deadurl= yes |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20060806081324/http://www.healtoronto.com/10reasons.html |archive-date= 6 August 2006 |df= dmy-all }}</ref> Suggested alternative causes of AIDS include [[recreational drug use|recreational drugs]], [[malnutrition]], and the very [[antiretroviral|antiretroviral drugs]] used to treat the syndrome.<ref>{{cite journal |last1= Duesberg |first1= P |last2= Koehnlein |first2= C |last3= Rasnick |first3= D |title= The chemical bases of the various AIDS epidemics: Recreational drugs, anti-viral chemotherapy and malnutrition |journal= [[Journal of Biosciences]] |volume= 28 |issue= 4 |pages= 383–412 |year= 2003 |pmid= 12799487 |doi= 10.1007/BF02705115}}</ref>
Such claims have been examined extensively in the [[peer-review]]ed medical and scientific literature; a [[scientific consensus]] has arisen that denialist claims have been convincingly disproved, and that HIV does indeed cause AIDS.<ref name=niaid /><ref name=cdcfacts>{{cite web | url = https://www.cdc.gov/hiv/basics/index.html | title = Basic Information about HIV and AIDS | publisher =[[Centers for Disease Control]] | date = 11 August 2010 | accessdate =4 February 2011 }}</ref> In the cases cited by Duesberg where HIV "cannot be isolated", [[PCR]] or other techniques demonstrate the presence of the virus,<ref>{{cite journal |last1= O'Brien |first1= SJ |last2= Goedert |first2= JJ |title= HIV causes AIDS: Koch's postulates fulfilled |journal= [[Current Opinion (Elsevier)|Current Opinion in Immunology]] |volume= 8 |issue= 5 |pages= 613–8 |year= 1996 |pmid= 8902385 |doi= 10.1016/S0952-7915(96)80075-6}}</ref> and denialist claims of HIV test inaccuracy result from an incorrect or outdated understanding of how HIV antibody testing is performed and interpreted.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kaisernetwork.org/health_cast/uploaded_files/081306_ias_sat_journalism.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070616224514/http://www.kaisernetwork.org/health_cast/uploaded_files/081306_ias_sat_journalism.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=16 June 2007 |title=HIV Science and Responsible Journalism |date=13 August 2006 |accessdate=17 December 2008 |publisher=[[XVI International AIDS Conference]] }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.aidstruth.org/denialism/denialists/giraldo-immunoassays | title=How Immunoassays Work: The Curious Case of AIDS Denialist Roberto Giraldo and his Ignorance of the Basics | publisher=Aidstruth.org | date=16 May 2008 | accessdate=17 December 2008 | last=Moore | first=John | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100706160310/https://www.aidstruth.org/denialism/denialists/giraldo-immunoassays | archivedate=6 July 2010}}</ref> Regarding Koch's postulates, ''[[New Scientist]]'' reported: "It is debatable how appropriate it is to focus on a set of principles devised for bacterial infections in a century when viruses had not yet been discovered. HIV does, however, meet Koch's postulates as long as they are not applied in a ridiculously stringent way". The author then demonstrated how each postulate has been met – the suspected cause is strongly associated with the disease, the suspected pathogen can be both isolated and spread outside the host, and when the suspected pathogen is transmitted to a new and uninfected host, that host develops the disease.<ref name=niaid /><ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.newscientist.com/article/dn17326-five-myths-about-hiv-and-aids.html | title = Five myths about HIV and AIDS | first = J | last = Steinberg | authorlink = Jonny Steinberg | work= [[New Scientist]] | date = 23 June 2009 | accessdate =4 February 2011}}</ref> The latter was proven in a number of tragic accidents, including an instance when multiple scientific technicians with no other known risk factors were exposed to concentrated HIV virus in a laboratory accident, and transmission by a dentist to patients, the majority of whom had no other known risk factor or source of exposure except the same dentist in common.<ref name=niaid /> In 2010, Chigwedere and [[Max Essex]] demonstrated in the [[medical journal]] ''[[AIDS and Behavior]]'' that HIV as the cause of AIDS fulfills both Koch's postulates and the [[Bradford Hill criteria]] for causality.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Chigwedere|first1=P |last2=Essex |first2=M |url=https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s10461-009-9654-7|title=AIDS Denialism and Public Health Practice|journal=AIDS and Behavior|date=8 January 2010|volume=14|issue=2|pages=237–47|doi=10.1007/s10461-009-9654-7|pmid=20058063}}</ref>
Early denialist arguments held that the HIV/AIDS paradigm was flawed because it had not led to effective treatments. However, the introduction of [[highly active antiretroviral therapy]] in the mid-1990s and dramatic improvements in survival of HIV/AIDS patients reversed this argument, as these treatments were based directly on anti-viral activity and the HIV/AIDS paradigm.<ref name="treatment-studies">Major studies confirming the benefits and effectiveness of modern anti-HIV therapy include, but are not limited to: * {{cite journal |last1= Lima |first1= V |last2= Hogg |first2= R |last3= Harrigan |first3= P |last4= Moore |first4= D |last5= Yip |first5= B |last6= Wood |first6= E |last7= Montaner |first7= J |doi=10.1136/bmj.324.7340.757 |url=http://bmj.bmjjournals.com/cgi/content/full/324/7340/757 |pmc=100314}} * {{cite journal |last1= Ivers |first1= L |last2= Kendrick |first2= D |last3= Doucette
